metadata.name: WTF? #5
metadata.description:
WTF? generative chaos

Press "s" to save image

metadata.name: ARAUCO #12
metadata.description:
The Araucaria Araucana, also known as pewén, is a sacred tree for the Mapuche and an emblem of Chile. With an origin dating back 260 million years to the Triassic period, it is part of the oldest forests on the planet. These ancient trees are endangered due to logging, forest fires, and grazing.

ARAUCO is a tribute to araucarias and Mapuche iconography. Incorporating elements such as the Kultrung, the Wünelfe star, and the staggered cross Ngümin, the work displays a typical landscape of southern Chile with the Andes Mountains in the background and the native forest. 

–

Press 's' to export a 4960x7016 PNG file suitable for A2 printing at 300 dpi.

Made with p5js.

Patricio Isaías, September 2022

CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 License

metadata.name: Melody #7
metadata.description:
Each output is generated by layering Blender renders.

The iterations are best viewed in Live Mode.

'Melody' explores color, space and geometry... with a touch of optical illusion thrown in!

It is called 'Melody' because each image resembles notes on a sheet of music.

In live mode:
Click/tap the image to make a "Download image" button appear. Click this button to download a 1800x2400px PNG.

metadata.name: Imi #23
metadata.description:
Recursive subdivision based on "returns", inspired by Imi Knoebel. (German painter and sculptor known for his contributions to and shaping of 20th century Minimalist abstract art.)

Click for new composition, doubleclick for fullscreen. Press s to save a printable SVG file.

metadata.name: Celestial Rings: Algorithmic Study #124
metadata.description:
This is an exploration to create an abstract artwork using fields and growth rings and their interaction with each other. Each of the mints can have several central rings up to 14 and the rings interact with each other to form a larger structure. The structure of the rings can be uniform or rotating, with mixed colors or mono colors. Various color palettes and canvas sizes have been used.

Open it in live view and press ’s’ to save image with high resolution.

Made with p5js.

metadata.name: Uninhabitable #193
metadata.description:
Uninhabitable is a generative system built only from ellipses. The process of playing with different geometric and trigonometric disruptions gives rise to four different compositions which seek to evoque living constructions and environments. Besides the shape itself and its related distortion, the stroke weight of the lines plays a meaningful role in the piece. Following a discrete range [0.01,0.1,1] the weight reveals the process allowing the viewer to realize the trace of the huge amount of lines in each piece. This back and forth between scales and context is, while kind of stripping the code, part of my continuing interest on understanding the -usually- crazy paths of machines' way of thinking.

Press "h" to see it and high resolution and refresh to get back to the initial state. Press "h" to save it.

Uninhabitable is an original work by Iskra Velitchkova. 2021.

metadata.name: Redols #70
metadata.description:
Redols is a piece about the automated arrangement of geometrical shapes in space and how the images generated can foster different moods. It visually investigates how to adjust the amount of randomness and repetition -both in the code loops and in the visual composition- to create structures that contain the mere essence of geometry and of movement.

It explores the repetitive use of a simple geometric shape: the circle. Adds some counterpoints to enhance it: squares, lines, and triangles which are found in the background. It focuses on circular shapes, not always drawing exactly. They change their core, their measure, the color, the gradient, or some subtle details. The arrangement uses an elliptical distribution and replicates some shapes to promote the visual recognition of bigger parts thus enhancing the movement feeling.

Redols is my genesis piece at fxhash curated by VerticalCrypto Art and Anika Meier.
Exhibited at IN TOUCH: art in the age of post-nftism show at Dekabinett, Berlin, september 2022.

Redols means circular shapes, not perfect ones, in Catalan and is an investigation of how deterministic processes and algorithms can create appealing arrangements that foster non machinic agencies and sentiments.

The piece is created by code, coding it from scratch, mixing, and mastering basic drawing techniques. This approach pays attention to the art piece getting old -I hope well- and makes it easier to show and view it on different computers and platforms to prevent its obsolescence.

I tested on Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Mac OS, Ubuntu, Android, and iPhone in vertical and horizontal mode, but please check it works on your device before minting.

----
possible features:
- colors:  super fosc marro, super blau, taronja-marro, taronja-blau, marro-taronja, marro-blau, blau-taronja, blau-marro.
- fons: quadradets, escaires, diagonals.
- fonsple: true, false.
- redols: equilibrat, mironia, migmig, degradats, vespa, mandarina, us, os, pla.
- fons2diagonals: true, false.

Anna Carreras 2022

metadata.name: Celestial Rings: Algorithmic Study #20
metadata.description:
This is an exploration to create an abstract artwork using fields and growth rings and their interaction with each other. Each of the mints can have several central rings up to 14 and the rings interact with each other to form a larger structure. The structure of the rings can be uniform or rotating, with mixed colors or mono colors. Various color palettes and canvas sizes have been used.

Open it in live view and press ’s’ to save image with high resolution.

Made with p5js.

metadata.name: Forgotten Memories #74
metadata.description:
Memories can be dark or they can be bright. Sometimes they are faint and pale, sometimes they are vivid and colorful. Sometimes they are hard to forget, sometimes they are easy to remember.

Memories are easily interrupted or even fractured, but they are also mostly always connected with other memories, whether they are related or not.

Forgotten Memories is what I consider to be my most ambitious study of color harmony yet. Each color represents a different category of memory, which are stored in our mind in layers of time. Their shapes differ in width and length depending on how weak/strong the memory was and how long it lasted.

Once a memory is forgotten, it may or may never be remembered again. But one thing that is not to be forgotten is that whether we choose to forget or remember, we are made of our memories.

* * *

Press S to save as PNG.
Press 1 to save with 1000px height.
Press 2 to save with 2000px height.

Made by: yenren / twitter.com/yenrenART
License: LICENSE.txt

metadata.name: Amara Celestial #195
metadata.description:
The universe is terrifyingly vast, mostly pitch-dark, save some billions of trillions of stars and planets. We are nothing. In all that vastness, we are the smallest fraction of time imaginable, floating around on a speck of dust. Yet somehow, we continue to work, learn, build relationships, create, and participate in all these other odd, uniquely human practices. It’s truly fascinating, when in the grand scheme, none of it seems consequential.

Amara Celestial is an artistic representation of this intergalactic madness and the love for it. To expand on the project’s identity…Amara, my wife’s name, has many meanings. In her culture and family, it means “love” or “everlasting beauty”. Celestial most commonly refers to things not of this world, but from the sky, or space. The shapes, lines, and primary design of this project represent the unpredictable nature of the universe. The entire piece is stippled with thousands of points of various palette selected colors, to resemble the uncountable number of light sources in the great sea of space, as well as to provide textural depth.

The Features:
- Canvas Style: Pretty simple, the canvas can be square (2048 x 2048), portrait (1352 X 2048) or landscape (2048 x 1352).
- Palettes: There are 10 different palettes, each with equal chance of being randomly chosen. The palettes were heavily influenced by my wife. She is a woman of South American descent and loves the bright colors and contrast often seen in the traditional clothing and art of her culture. There are a few muted palettes, including a mono palette to mix things up!
- Background Color: The background color can be black, white, or blue with varying rarity.
- Background Noise: This controls the level of turbulence in the background shape (if drawn).
- Primary Noise: This controls the level of turbulence in the primary shape (i.e., the foremost shape).
- Secondary Noise: This controls the level of turbulence in the secondary shape.
- Posterize: This is a color limiting filter that can cause harsher (less smooth) changes in color. The lower the number, the more abrupt the changes (2 being the lowest allowed).
- Primary Shape Centered: This is a true/false based on whether the primary shape is centered on the canvas.
- Background override: This will override the selected background and replace it with vertical or horizontal lines, or prevent the background shape from being drawn entirely.

Other randomness factors (non-features)
- Stroke thickness on various shapes and points of the project.
- Size of the overall shapes, as well as the size of the inner radius of the shapes.
- Spacing between the stippling and lines (to keep it pattern-less).
- Positioning of all the shapes (restricted to the canvas).
- The number of iterations (rings) for each shape.

metadata.name: Unrestrained #7
metadata.description:
I am revolving yet static,
at once simple and emphatic.
My rules are maintained,
Yet by my frame I'm unrestrained.

This is a generative piece made in p5.js.

metadata.name: chimpantez #279
metadata.description:
The Chimpantez is a collections of 1,000 PFP NFT. Each Chimpantez is unique and randomly generated out of hand-drawn traits.
your chimpanzee allows you to get special benefits in the future.


This collection was made generatively by the help of @purespider


Artist twitter link: https://twitter.com/TheGuns_2D

metadata.name: Uncontained #40
metadata.description:
Moving between points, but with freedom.
Chaotic, dynamic, but not really random.
In a frame, but not contained.
With a purpose, but not constrained.
Predestined, but with free agency.
I hope you don't hurt from my latency.

This is a generative piece made in p5.js.
